So I then contact them on that date and they said we promise it will be with you by two days ago.No refund received. The customer service consultant I spoke to was not only unhelpful but also exhibited rudeness. Overall, my experience with Crucial was disappointing and did not meet the standards one would expect from a reputable company.

Review.Titre: X6 Drive not received and no reply to my email
Review.Contenu: X6 Drive not received and no reply to my email belowI understand that you sent the parcel but my complaint is that the parcel was received in damaged condition and the contents were missing.The package was sent "Tracked 24" by Royal Mail and no signature was required. The package was posted through my letter box with the rest of my mail so I had no chance to reject it. In order to make a claim on Royal Mail after using Tracked 24 it must be the sender that makes the claim as the sender will have the information required to make the claim. Goods sent using Tracked 24 are insured up to the value of £200 so what needs to happen is that Crucial makes a claim on Royal Mail for the value of the missing goods and send me replacements for the goods I have not received, preferably  using registered post for which a signature is required.

Review.Titre: Bad start when the Crucial scanner…

I advised that I had 8GB and was told that a further 8GB was the max for a Dell OptiPlex 9020. A link was provided to Amazon and I purchased from there understanding that inserting the purchased Amazon/Crucial memory would fill the only remaining RAM slot and provide 16GB in total. Unfortunately, when I subsequently opened the computer, I had 4GB in each existing slot and therefore now have a just 12GB after upgrade. The Crucial technical direction was misleading and I would not have purchased if the advice had been clearer. I raised this with Crucial but they offered no assistance. Disappointed ☹

Shipment Tracking Numbers: QS332482815GB (spring) Product SKU	 CT1000T500SSD8	Crucial T500 1TB PCIe Gen4 NVMe M.2 SSD	Order Number: 1111933534339 Order Date: 20 November 2023Edit 3 - I've now had 2 separate emails from Crucial. I returned a faulty SSD drive under warranty to Crucial UK (K Line logistics returns). The product was recommended to me by my IT advisor. The SSD drive ceased working only 7 months into its life. I expected a smooth and event free replacement service under warranty for what was a premium product. I followed the returns process using an RMA code supplied. The SSD drive was confirmed as received at K Line on 12 October. I was advised that I needed to allow 10 working days before a replacement could be issued to me. The 10 days have expired and still absolutely no feedback or contact from Crucial. I have spoken to the customer team in an overseas office 3 times and the chat service 4 times. They said it would be escalated and I would hear immediately - I did not. Given that the SSD drive was used to back up my computer files I am left exposed whilst awaiting a resolution of this painful process. I am mightily unimpressed with the whole process. If someone from Crucial reads this would you have the decency to get in touch with me. I am at the end of my tether with this.

I used there online scanner to check what Ram upgrade and SSD I could put in my laptop.Placed my order choosing out of what was listed, and waited for delivery, delivery was slow not the Royal Mail 24 due to fact it did not even come from in the UK.On arrival I had problems and the parts were not compatible, I contacted the Manufacture who advised  what I had purchased would not work in my machine.I started the return process and followed the instructions, Return postage was on me even though I purchased what they told me would work.Items shown delivered on 01.03.2023 and proof of postage shows my package on a desk.I still do not have a refund and it shows waiting for return, I phoned them on the 09.03.2023 and was told yes we have it and it takes 15 days, today is 17 days and an agent just told me they have not received it, until I shown it was delivered and now he is puzzled and does not know what to say.So I am out of pocket £120, hopefully paypal will sort this mess out and get my refund.There online scanner is not 100% correct even though they say it is, and there returns are a night mare.

Review.Titre: They used to be so good
Review.Contenu: I used to use Crucial a lot and was always pleased with their service.  However, something has changed.  Their delivery is now pants.  I ordered an item with a delivery of 10 working days.  They didn’t ship the order until 6 days after my order.  Since then, it has been crawling across Europe from Prague to Pulheim and to The Hague.  I don’t have a problem with the delivery method but every stop causes a lengthy delay.  For example, it got to The Hague 4 days ago.  I have no idea if or when it will start moving again.  I would not order from Crucial again.  The end of an era.I’m still waiting for my item.  It’s not in the UK so it misses the promised 10 working day delivery.  I’ll give it until the end of the week and then I will claim a refund.

Review.Titre: No Delivery and no communication. delivered over ten
Review.Contenu: Device not yet delivered over ten later. No emails to advise on problems. Product may be excellent - it would good to see it.
Despite the Curcial page guaranteeing the RAM was definitely for my computer it's toally wrong. I wanted RAM for a desktop and they sent one for a laptop.
Took too long to deliver. Had to go and buy a competitor product and will return the crucial memory, whenever it arrives.

Review.Titre: Dreadful service from beginning to end!
Review.Contenu: Dreadful service from beginning to end!1.  Even though I paid for priority delivery, this was never put in place.2.  Logistics paperwork failure means my order is now stuck in customs.3.  On contacting Crucial about the failure of priority delivery, the customer service agent made no attempt to ensure a speedy delivery was made.4 On contacting Crucial about items being stuck in customs due to paperwork issues, the First Custome4 Support Agent cut me off after failing to understand th3 complaint, and the second one refused to agree to a cancellation of a no longer needed or wanted product ( due to the ongoing delays) or arrange a refund for the undelivered product within the agreed contract timescale.I’ve been using Crucial for nearly 10 years but the last 18 months have seen a rapid and devastating collapse of customer service, due in part to a wholly disinterested and deliberately obstructive outsourced customer services team, but also due to a complete failure of Crucial to ensure reasonable supply chain mechanisms.Do not shop with Crucial.  Their new approach to customer service is a clear indication that the quality of their products is soon to decline too.
Not received yet. Apparently out of stock but nobody thought to advise me until I made contact.

Review.Contenu: Its been a month and i have not received my product. No information or consolidation has been shared..

Parcel had excellent tracking information for the first 4 days then nothing, spoke to customer service who was rubbish!!! No help at all, very disappointed
Not enough tracking information.This item has not arrived yet and we have no idea when it should be here.
ordered from Crucial on 18 January 2023 now first February an no sign of order
crucial is crapi bought 64 gb's off ram and it said it was in stock when i bought it that was 12/06/2023 it is now 09/07/2023 and my order is Order Status:  Order in Process

Review.Titre: I ordered ssd 15 days back and still…
Review.Contenu: I ordered ssd 15 days back and still haven’t received it. Lol. This is the  last time I’m ordering from crucial. Thanks for your service.You suck

Review.Titre: A complaint from a UK Customer who ordered from Crucial Online.
Review.Contenu: A complaint from a customer in the UK who ordered from UK-CRUCIAL.COM, but as yet hasn't receive their goods despite the fact I was advised it was on 24 tracked delivery from RM. I ordered 2 x 32gb SSD for my PC from uk-crucial.com on the 17th May. On the 18th May, I was advised of the RM tracking number on Royal Mail 24. However the info on RM never updated, and by 22nd May, the tracking had not changed and there was no record of the goods being processed via RM.I contact RM who advised they hadn't received it and if they had, that it would be in their system in under 12 hrs. I contacted Crucial twice on Monday 22nd May and on both instances I was misfed information and it was not made clear. The first online support agent, told me that it was near a weekend and the system in RM had not had a chance to update - I needed to allow 10 days. - yeah right, it was not a Bank Holiday weekendThe second support agent again said was part of the Spring shipping (This was never explained to me), it could take 10 days and if i hadnt received it by 2nd June, to contact them again.Today I contacted them again by phone, this time it started to be clearer, the memory I ordered came from Prague, it is shipped by a courier company called SPRING, and travels from Prague to UK on their service and then when it arrives in UK, it is picked up by Royal Mail on a 24 hr delivery. They supplied me with the link to Spring, and I can see my goods were shipped on the 18th, and currently on the 23rd May its in Germany, I was advised it will hit the UK for delivery on 25th or 26th May, with the latest being Monday 29th May!So the information about 24hr Royal Mail is in effect not true, its only 24hr from when Royal Mail receive it, which will be 9/10 days from when it was "posted" in Prague. Be warned. NOT a good service and I would suggest using Amazon who will deliver on Prime in 24hrs! It would be helpful is UK Crucial advised their customers of the International part and that goods can take longer and not to rely on the RM Track 24 number!

The Hard Drive was ordered on the basis of Crucial offering 24Hr Royal Mail Delivery .. Little did I realise that that the "24Hr tracked delivery" was once the Hard Drive had arrived in the UK after a long and arduous journey from Prague I could have bought the same product on Amazon with delivery next day for a comparable cost!

Review.Titre: Despite running the Crucial app the…
Review.Contenu: Despite running the Crucial app the recommended RAM did not work. Took a week to arrive. Returns process seems to be working so far....

Review.Titre: Shipping took ages  hence long waiting…
Review.Contenu: Shipping took ages  hence long waiting time to get the item delivered from Checz republic to UK.

This was the first time I ordered from crucial and probably my last, although the products (SSD) were delivered to me, but they were delivered in the time frame of the normal delivery window (14 days) which was free, whereas I paid for a fast delivery (2-4 days) and paid an extra £7 for it. On getting the issue raised with their customer care department their attitude was non serious and he wasn't even apologetic. Basically I was scammed of £7 and for a company this big and an amount so small it raises big red flags, enough for myself to refrain from ordering in future and to warn others.

The products I bought (extra RAM and SSD) are first class, exactly as described and perfect new, unopened condition. The reason for only 2 stars was delivery, ridiculously slow. 2 weeks to arrive. I could have paid extra for fast delivery but these days normal post from anywhere in Europe is 3-4 days at the most. From what I can tell the items were sent from Germany, so normally with standard post would be 3 days (I've had normal post deliveries from Germany previously turn up next-day) so no excuse for 14 days. I'm guessing these were not posted for many days after the order was placed, or they were originally in China (or similar country). If not for this I would have given a FULL 5 STARS.

First let me state; I always use crucial. I think the scanner tool is excellent and the quality always shines through. This time however the delivery has been shocking! You may blame the strikes and the festive delays but the communication has been woeful. I selected standard delivery but 11 days to deliver the item is shocking. This was a business order and my customer has had to wait!

Review.Titre: SSD drive problems caused by crucial software
Review.Contenu: Purchased memory and SSD drive. Memory installed with no problems.  Three calls later I was told by customer services that the SSD wouldn't install because of a problem with the cloning software downloaded from the website. They suggested I use a different cloning software but left to decide which to choose and purchase.

Review.Titre: The memory is OK - Delivery is MEH!
Review.Contenu: The memory is OK - it does what it says on the tin, nothing more or less.Delivery was *just* within the expected time of 5-10 working days, or 14 days in real money. Crucial sees nothing wrong with this time scale for free delivery.Personally, I think their logistics are rubbish. Its possible to get the same memory from Amazon or eBuyer with next day delivery at the same or lower price.With the long delivery time, I wonder what the turn around time would be on faulty products. My guess is unacceptable, but I hope never to find out.I may buy crucial products again, but will never buy direct from them. Its just not worth it.

Review.Titre: Still waiting for delivery nearly 2 weeks after ordering...
Review.Contenu: Still waiting for delivery nearly 2 weeks after the order was shipped. Very poor/inaccurate delivery status information also. I've ordered from Crucial quite a few times over the last few years and always had good service, but something has gone badly wrong this time. This has definitely put me off ordering from them direct again.

Bought direct thinking best price. Never again! Just takes ages. Might as well go with Samsung again and get from Amazon, usually next day! Transferring big video files, (30G plus) performance is very erratic. AJA tests with cache off. Used in USB-C enclosures proven with several other M2 brands.

Review.Titre: The delivery has still not happened…
Review.Contenu: The delivery has still not happened despite the order being placed 3 weeks ago!Crucial used to be a good company to deal with but this is sadly not the case anymore.

Delivery was slow. Why does your top selling product have to be shipped from the Czech Republic through Germany to the UK. Absolutely bonkers. The Acronis software is dire for disk cloning. Took me 3 days of going through the same procedure to get it to work.

Ordered the DDR4 cards for a laptop upgrade, Crucial site was great, The cards took a long time to be delivered - thank UPS for this -doesn't matter, Crucial use them, so it was Crucial's fault. A shame this marked down the scores, but I have to be honest.

Allleged 10 day shipping wich in itself is a disgrace,  this is day 13 from date of order on the 13th of May,  tracking only showing to be delivered on the 26th of May Not impressed , spring is useless and gets poor reviews itself Your not helping your own reputation

Ordered some DDR5 ram for my laptop on 14th November and its now 28th November and I still have no idea when the Ram will arrive. I thought I had seen something like 5-8 or 8-10 days shipping when i made the purchase from the site but I dont seem to have any confirmation of this anywhere so I am just left in the dark when this would come. The tracking number provided doesn't really give me any useful information on when it is going to arrive just says its been through Czech Republic, Germany and Netherlands and cleared customs but the last update was 5 days ago so who knows really?

Review.Titre: Considering I still haven't received my…
Review.Contenu: Considering I still haven't received my item yet and your pushing for a review your not doing very well my item was initially out of stock fair enough after around 10 days my item is despatched me thinking it's in the UK and on a royal mail 24hr delivery should be with me the next day or so. Not the case it's coming from Prague then on to the Netherlands in customs now eventually in the UK but not with me yet. So as for service not great as for the item can't tell you I haven't got it yet.

I have  used Crucial.com before and was very impressed by their  products. I purchased  one  of their  500GB SSD and Laptop ram and was very happy with the  product and recommended the site to  others.  However, I recently  had to  upgrade a family  member's gaming pc to upgrade their  memory to 32gb  so  I  used  Crucial Memory ordered 4x 8GB ram dims  got  3 that  worked and 1 defective.  The  original  post  was much faster than  now which is  Much SLOWER than  I remember.  Trying to  resolve the defective 8GB chip has  been unnecessarily difficult  AND SLOW.  I will  not  be using  or  recommending Crucial  again. The  PC has  been with  me  almost 5 weeks or  more.  Unacceptable!

I've bought from crucial in the past and found the product to be excellent. I've recently purchased more memory and expect the quality to be just as good when the memory eventually turns up. This is the essence of my poor review, the delivery time is awful and I'm getting very frustrated. I will very likely try another provider when I next need memory.

Ordered a SSD on 23/12/22, and realised it wasn't stocked in the UK and had to come from EU. Due to customs, Christmas and royal mail strikes it wouldn't arrive till early January. In the meantime Argos had a sale of Samsung SSD, so I purchased one and installed it using Samsung Data Migration in less than 2 hours!On 07/01/23 the Crucial SSD arrived. Tried to install it on my wife's laptop using the Acronis TrueImage software. Unfortunately, Acronis said it had cloned my HD successfully, but the SSD failed to boot up when swapped. Eventually, I used Macrium Reflect and it worked first time when the SSD was swapped!Also just mention, Samsung Magician is soo much better/faster than Crucial Storage Executive.I would say that Crucial needs to look at Samsung to see how to make their product better and easier to install...

Review.Titre: Fantastic products let down by poor delivery information
Review.Contenu: Crucial products are extremely good and are at reasonable prices. The problem is that there is little or no update on shipping information. One of my orders was shown as having cleared a customs zone but had no information as to whether Royal Mail had picked it up. I had to make an enquiry to Crucial and was asked to be patient. Royal mail did eventually deliver the item and I was very satisfied with its performance.

Like many hereI I've used crucial memory for decades and trusted it, returns issues were previously sorted out very efficiently.I recently bought laptop ram + mx500 1tb, thankfully I bought it from amazon. But trying to get some support for their faulty SSD software is impossible, the tech support are really clueless now.For 2 weeks, just been given the run around from the same 3 line script, reinstall, try another pc, check firmware. I've given up dealing with them and are worried if any other issues arise.The performance of both hardware ram + ssd are faultless and I've found to use command line tools that work from their website as a work around.Kinda pathetic considering their stature and technical capabilities previously.

Review.Titre: Crucial unwilling to resolve delivery problem
Review.Contenu: Selecting and purchasing the memory was simple and I am confident that, if I had received it, it would have fitted. The is that I used Paypal to pay, which meant that Crucial took the delivery address from Paypal, and somehow the first line of the address wasn't included. This meant that the courier couldn't deliver the package, although their system said it had been. I spoke to Crucial pointing out the problem and that they need to contact the courier, as that was the only route to resolve the issue. The Crucial staff member ignored that and told me to contact them instead. I don't know why the address line was missing as it was there in the Paypal account record. I've asked Paypal for a refund as I haven't received what I ordered and apparently Crucial aren't willing to help sort out why.

Review.Titre: Firstly it was out of stock then you…
Review.Contenu: Firstly it was out of stock then you say it has been despatched on Wednesday under 24 hour service. Trouble is you are using Royal Mail that is on strike so still has not even left your premises by Sunday. Maybe arriving in the next week but no idea.

Review.Titre: Crucial used to have a good reputation…
Review.Contenu: Crucial used to have a good reputation on both product and service, and I have used them on countless times in the past for both business and personal purposes without comparison until now.I am used to service, and without question ordered a SSD from Crucial, expecting the service I have received in the past.It took 11 days for Crucial to deliver one PCIe SSD. In that time I purchased an alternative product from a more reliable supplier, so wont be bothering with Crucial again.

Review.Titre: Terribly slow free delivery lesson learnt!
Review.Contenu: As always the ordering went well but I should not have gone with free delivery. It was ordered on the 6th and did not arrive until the 18th spending days just sitting in a warehouse. Still having trouble cloning onto it but will try again

Ordered from Crucial UK. 500GB SSD. Product works well - but the process of receiving product was full of angst. Product dispatched from Holland using Netherlands postal service, Spring. Tracking stopped after it left Holland. Arrived 16 days after order placed. Lucky to receive at all as address label left off my: house name, street and county.

Just too slow.The two items I purchased were shipped from Prague to near Bristol in the UK and took a week.I could have bought the two or equivalent items from Amazon with next day delivery for about £10 more, but wanted to support the manufacturer more. Anyway lesson learnt.

Delivered from Netherlands at snails pace. 10 days for an in stock item to arrive. Like many on here I wish I'd checked before ordering from Crucial again. In the past they used to ship from the UK, but now they're shipping from the Netherlands. It took five days for the package to even leave the Netherlands and that's for an item that was in stock.Two stars as the memory worked fine when it eventually arrived, but do yourself a favour, give your custom to a company that actually wants your business. There's no excuse for a delivery system this poor.

Review.Titre: Drive is good, cloning software is garbage
Review.Contenu: The drive it’s self is pretty good but the cloning software is garbage. I was led to believe it was quite a straightforward process and a novice could do it, Wrong. I had to get an I.T expert to do it in the end

The products are good but the company has suddenly dropped in quality.They dispatched an order 4 days after I cancelled (within 5 mins of it being placed) it and forcing me to pay postage to Czeck Republic as they have closed their UK distribution centre.The cancellation link on the UK website directs you to the wrong team who cannot cancel, and the correct email address to contact is not shown.1 star for service, they can have an extra star as the product is actually good.

Review.Titre: Delivery time was far too long
Review.Contenu: Delivery time was far too long - prob thanks to Brexit and shipment issues from Czech Republic If it had been mission crucial then it would have been serious

Took much longer to arrive than would be reasonably expected and the ease of cloning from 1TB to 4TB was not as straightforward as you advertised. The reliance you offer on out of date / irrelevant software and FAQ type support was not helpful either. After a couple of days researching and trying to solve the issue myself including purchasing other third party software  (which didnt work), in desparation I upgraded the software you supplied with the full and proper version from Acronis. This fixed the issue almost immediately. It wasn't rocket science. Windows will only recognise and use up to 2TB. Anything above that has to be partioned as another drive. If you can't be bothered to consider a decent use case for cloning from Windows to a larger than 2TB hard drive (Costing £300+) and also, keep your support software and instructions up to date, then I don't think I can be bothered to shop with you again any time soon. Very disappointing.

Review.Titre: Two weeks and still in transit
Review.Contenu: I ordered the ram upgrade on the 26th of January 2023. It is now the 8th of February and the product is still in transit. I realise that the royal mail are having issues after a cyber attack but using an alternative carrier would have mitigated the issue.

Review.Titre: The item arrives and the nightmare began...
Review.Contenu: I ordered the part. It came quickly. I had to return the item because it wasn't compatible, and this is where my nightmare starts. Do not follow any of the advice given to you by the 'Live Chat' or the Helpline. I actually wanted a refund, but the 'Live Help Advisor' told me I could  order what RAM I wanted by clicking the replacement button rather than the refund button. This was not true. It wasn't long before I realised English was not his native language and he simply didn't understand what I was asking him. I tried the phone line but had the same problem. I eventually got the matter sorted, but had I known that their Helpline and Live Help wasn't based in the UK or another native speaking country, I wouldn't have bothered.

Review.Titre: Under the impression that you are…
Review.Contenu: Under the impression that you are buying from Crucial UK when in fact the order comes from Czech Republic. I would have looked at alternatives to get the Ram sooner.

Review.Titre: Product is excellent.....but getting it is a nightmare
Review.Contenu: Product is excellentCrucial seem to want to charge £8 for fast delivery.  Too much for a letter!I opted out and was treateed to an 8 day catalogue of movements of my memory from CZ to GY to HL to UK and then the Royal Mail hub.  This is far too long and this is not the Crucial I have purchased from over many years.  I will find another supplier next time.

Review.Titre: Shoddy delivery service. it took nearly 3 weeks.
Review.Contenu: the ram was meant to be next day delivery, it took nearly 3 weeks to arrive. Also, the sales rep, I spoke to regarding delivery status was not helpful.

Review.Titre: Whatever has happened to your delivery…
Review.Contenu: Whatever has happened to your delivery times, this order took over a week to arrive, far too long in 2022, you need to get a distribution hub in the UK. It's back to Mr Memory for me :-(
Product fine, five stars. Pestering for reviews sadly is so annoying, so only two stars in the review.

Review.Titre: Only order if your happy to wait 2 weeks.
Review.Contenu: The products themselves are first rate. However Crucial no longer have customer services or a fulfillment centre in the UK. This means paying for express delivery just means receiving your order in 13 days instead of 14. Customer services were of little help. Just repeating the same sentences,  and making zero acknowledgement of my request to look at the tracking info they had provided. This tracking showed the items didn't ship for 13 days then suddenly did. Customer services were adamant they had shipped but chose not to address facts in black and white. I could have ordered the same goods from amazon with next day delivery for cheaper, even with the sale price and discount code so it was quite underwhelming. Eventually C.S refunded my carriage fee. Worth noting I had placed 2 orders at the same time. 1 normal free shipping,  1 express. Had the royal mail not mis sorted the normal one, it would have arrived a day before the express rather than the same day. Had Customer services said the goods will take 2 weeks to come from Thailand to Eastern Europe fulfilment Centre, or they are being built at the factory for example , I would not have panicked. They did not give any reassurances, ignored their own tracking information and it took multiple emails over 2 weeks to make zero progress. I love Crucial products.  Had it been clear delivery is a 2 week lead time, I'd have ordered elsewhere and not have a 2 week delay to my upgrades.

Review.Titre: Sadly feels like a company gone bad. Poor from beginning to delivery and packaging..
Review.Contenu: Sadly feels like a company gone bad. Poor from beginning to delivery and packaging. Can only get worse if memory also fails! Packaging to protect something as fragile as a memory stick was near nonexistent! Large envelope with thin bubble wrap, no box! for memory stick to swim around. The verse: bought some memory on the 8th of May and stated 5 to 10 days delivery Which I was ok with. Now realising they mean business days so in effect one to 2 weeks. Given all other deliveries are broadly back in normal delivery time It still took 12 days.On day 11, I contacted customer support as the tracking link didn't work. After being reassured to wait a few more days, I checked the link, and the memory was coming from the Netherlands! Arrived today, pushed through the letterbox. Callous decision to put fragile memory, with no box, inside a large envelope with slim bubble wrap. I mean, this thing has been swimming across Europe for 12 days! It'll be a small miracle if it still works!

Review.Titre: You sell great products at reasonable…
Review.Contenu: You sell great products at reasonable prices, plus your PC scanner to find compatible products is amazing.  However the delivery information is not very good plus the actual delivery time is too long.

Review.Titre: You advised that the item would be…
Review.Contenu: You advised that the item would be posted Royal Mail 24hr tracked,I didn't realize that it had to be shipped from outside the UK first and took actually 14 days to arrive.

Review.Titre: Bought a 500gb SSD P3 Plus to replace…
Review.Contenu: Bought a 500gb SSD P3 Plus to replace SSD in Dell laptop, but it failed after about 2 months contacted support at Amazon who transferred me to Crucial support who were unhelpful, Amazon stepped in and  will replace the SSD in the next day
Very slow delivery. Crucial was always my go to for clients upgrades. I will no longer be using this service.

Review.Titre: A complaint from a customer in the UK…
Review.Contenu: A complaint from a customer in the UK who ordered from UK-CRUCIAL.COM, but as yet hasn't receive their goods despite the fact I was advised it was on 24 tracked delivery from RM. I ordered 2 x 32gb SSD for my PC from uk-crucial.com on the 17th May. On the 18th May, I was advised of the RM tracking number on Royal Mail 24. However the info on RM never updated, and by 22nd May, the tracking had not changed and there was no record of the goods being processed via RM.I contact RM who advised they hadn't received it and if they had, that it would be in their system in under 12 hrs. I contacted Crucial twice on Monday 22nd May and on both instances I was misfed information and it was not made clear. The first online support agent, told me that it was near a weekend and the system in RM had not had a chance to update - I needed to allow 10 days. - yeah right, it was not a Bank Holiday weekendThe second support agent again said was part of the Spring shipping (This was never explained to me), it could take 10 days and if i hadnt received it by 2nd June, to contact them again.Today I contacted them again by phone, this time it started to be clearer, the memory I ordered came from Prague, it is shipped by a courier company called SPRING, and travels from Prague to UK on their service and then when it arrives in UK, it is picked up by Royal Mail on a 24 hr delivery. They supplied me with the link to Spring, and I can see my goods were shipped on the 18th, and currently on the 23rd May its in Germany, I was advised it will hit the UK for delivery on 25th or 26th May, with the latest being Monday 29th May!So the information about 24hr Royal Mail is in effect not true, its only 24hr from when Royal Mail receive it, which will be 9/10 days from when it was "posted" in Prague. Be warned. NOT a good service and I would suggest using Amazon who will deliver on Prime in 24hrs! It would be helpful is UK Crucial advised their customers of the International part and that goods can take longer and not to rely on the RM Track 24 number!
Renegade on order after reasonable delay and finally cancelling my order without due time to answer final email after a lot of trouble getting through to them.
Quoted 2 weeks delivery. Didn't take that long but still took over 1 week, which is terrible in this day and age.

You will find two updates below, following on from exchanges with the company over their chat. The response from Crucial relates only to the first review of 26th November.Original review 26th November.At the time of writing I am not reviewing the product - I can't; it hasn't yet arrived - but Crucial's customer service.I ordered a solid state drive on 18th November (a Friday). What has become apparent is that Crucial simply do not work at weekends. The money was not, according to my credit card, taken until the following Monday, 21st.More to the point, there is no contact email address, and the only means of contact are via Chat or 'phone, with these services only operating during business hours Monday to Friday.Be warned, these items are shipped from the Czech Republic. That shouldn't really be a problem - except that the item then took days to reach Holland (via Germany). It then, according to the tracking record, left Holland on 24th November. It is now 26th, and the item appears to have disappeared into the ether. There is no record of it having reached the UK.Today is a Saturday, so there will be no possibility of chasing up the company until Monday.Maybe it will arrive on Monday. Regardless, having such limited means to contact the company means that I shall certainly hesitate before ever buying anything else from Crucial.I know that Crucial make good products. These difficulties with contacting them, however, make for poor advertising for the company as a whole.Update on 2nd December.I have now reduced my overall opinion of Crucial from two stars to one star.It is now eight days since my order left The Hague en route to the UK, having previously taken three days to reach Holland from The Czech Republic.It is clearly lost, but Crucial still insist - during the course of a long chat (and despite the advice that I could "escalate" the matter; see their response below) - that I wait the full ten business days before they will "help" me with a refund. Incidentally, ten business days does not count from the day that I submitted the order, but from the day that Crucial submitted the order to the courier. Since it is impossible to contact the company over the weekend I shall have waited well over two weeks for an order which, barring total miracles, will not arrive, and they know it will not arrive. I asked them three times whether there was any additional information they could provide which might lead me to believe otherwise. On each occasion they simply ignored the question.The suggestion in Crucial's previous response that Royal Mail strikes might be contributing to the delay is a complete red herring. The strikes would not have prevented the handover from Spring, the original carrier, to Royal Mail. RM, on their own website are quite clear that they are expecting the package, but have not so far received it.There is also, contrary to the information provided by Crucial in their response, no email contact listed on the link they cite.Final update - 6th DecemberAnother tedious 40 minutes on Crucial's Chat. They did finally agree to make an immediate refund; though no offer of compensation. What they offered me was ten per cent off my next order; as though I would even consider ordering anything else off them after this experience.I have upgraded this review to two stars. At least the refund did indeed come through within minutes.

Review.Titre: Order took too long and you sent the…
Review.Contenu: Order took too long and you sent the wrong cable to connect the hard drive to my laptop

Review.Titre: It took sooo long to arrive
Review.Contenu: It took sooo long to arrive, I thoink i'm right in thinking it had to come from poland!
Arrived but tracking terrible and trying to get hold and receive reply's terrible

I first ordered memory for my PC several months ago, which was shown as being in stock. Immediately it went out of stock and never came back. Eventually Crucial cancelled the order. I subsequently ordered slightly different but compatible memory. That took 10 days to arrive. Although it is now installed and working as it should, the whole process was just too slow.

Review.Titre: I still don't have my memory upgrade.
Had to cancel order to get items delivered
Review.Contenu: Ordered some kit from them using the express delivery (1-3) day option.  Showed all kit was in stock at time of order.  3 days pass, order still showing as in progress, get on live chat to them, get told waiting on a part to come back into stock, give it 24 hours.  Check again 24 hours later, after seeing part is in stock on the website, then goes out of stock the morning after.  Contact support again, get told to wait a week until part comes in.  Ask how they can show the part as in stock on day of order but not allocate the stock to the customer that ordered it, and how stock can come back in and not be allocated for an already placed order (This was an 8GB stick of 2666 RAM, don't think that people were buying hundreds of these).  Get told that my order is a priority order and that I need to wait a week, delivery will be refunded, no response to my question on allocation of stock.  Contact support later in the day to arrange a cancellation as not wanting to wait another week for kit to be delivered, customer service tries to tell me that this is a priority order and that they are working on getting this kit out and that due to CoVID it may take some time, again completely ignoring my request.  Pushed for a cancellation, got a cancellation request number.Got a text on my phone at 6pm yesterday telling me that UPS have a parcel for me, after checking the origination country find out it is Crucial, so had to cancel my order to get them to send me the equipment that was ordered.  If this had been due to CoVID I wouldn't have minded (have some stuff ordered with another supplier that can't get it to me because of the lockdown), this is poor stock management and mis-allocation of purchases.Customer service only try and fob you off with excuses and time lines that mean they don't have to deal with you for a while.

i ordered a ram online, it arrived in perfect condition but the only problem that occured is that when i installed it, it made my laptop much slower which i have no idea why and tried to revert it though nothing really worked, perhaps next time people can know what ram can work with what brand before only knowing if it’s compatible or not to the pc/laptop
Easy enough to order but too early to ask me to give a review when the item hasn't arrived yet.

It should be made clear on the site that the free delivery option is (appallingly) slow.  It turns out it’s an 8 day expected delivery time, mainly because it’s coming from the Czech Republic, which is also not made clear.  Chat support is no help either and the advisor disappeared mid-chat after telling me what I already knew.  Just a bit of upfront clarity and honesty on the Crucial website would avoid all these poor reviews about delivery (not the product).
Awful communication on delivery. Free delivery is 10 working days so if you're desperate you should pay for delivery.

As ever, the Crucial hardware was second to none, but the delivery process was painfully hopeless, the tracking worse. Seeing a fast SSD make very slow progress across Europe, apparently by packhorse, is not much help when you have a failing disk. No option of express delivery. Why?

When the order was placed the shipping detail implied 24 hours (one working day).  Well, that was correct once it was in the UK.  Items took one week to get from Czech Republic.  If they had been honest about the delivery time I would not have minded but this generated a delay in work on my side.  I hope the products are good as this delay has prevented installation at this time.

Review.Titre: Items out of stock and on back order…
Review.Contenu: Items out of stock and on back order for more than 2 weeks

Review.Titre: Cannot coment on articles at moment as…
Review.Contenu: Cannot coment on articles at moment as I have not received them yet. When i ordered the items easily enough I then received an e-mall informing me there had been a run on the items and I would possibly have to wait seven days until new stock is available for which I am still waiting delivery.

Review.Titre: The delivery was too long and misleading
Review.Contenu: The product was OK and worked the first time but1. I had no instructions on where to get the 10% discount as promised in the email. I had to contact the helpline.2. On the Crucial confirmation email, it refers to a Royal Mail 24 hr delivery service. In fact, delivery is 5 to 7 working days - ordered on Wednesday and delivered on Friday of the following week. This is not only misleading but it is too long when Amazon does next-day deliveries regularly.

Review.Titre: I used the crucial scan programme to…
Review.Contenu: I used the crucial scan programme to assess upgrade options for my laptop. I chose new memory on that basis. Unfortunately the memory that I received was for a desktop and not compatible. Upon further investigation there isn't anything I can do to increase the memory in my laptop either as It is at maximum. Crucial have agreed to a refund so no complaints in that department.

Review.Titre: For a cutting edge tech company I was…
Review.Contenu: For a cutting edge tech company I was appalled that a simple mistake on my address could not be rectified. The answer given was to cancel and reorder (with a wait for funds to be returned). Shockingly bad!!! The SSD is awesome!
Good product but delivery took far to long.

Ordered “in stock” components on 5-8 day delivery. 18 days later 1 component has apparently shipped from Czechoslovakia, the other 2 are out of stock for another 5 working days (allegedly)… no timescale for actual delivery so suspect being spun a line. Support blame it on a technology update - that’s right a technology company that hasn’t managed a technology change properly. Awful service. 1st and almost certainly last order.

Got a message saying my drive had been dispatched yesterday by Royal Mail tracked 24 via Spring Global(who?) , but that tracking hasn't updated at all, so my guess reading the comments here, is it hasn't been dispatched by Royal Mail tracked 24 at all, and will be arriving from somewhere abroad at some point. Why isn't this made clear when ordering, as I'd have gone elsewhere to get it quicker? I note that the company say there are quicker delivery options, but there weren't any when I placed my order. Seems quite deceitful to me. Disappointed.Update : Four days on, and the Spring tracking is still showing 'Parcel created', no dispatch at all.Further update :Crucial customer service contacted me to say the item was dispatched on 12th October, so how come the tracking link they provided, shows the parcel as not being accepted by the carrier until late at night on 17th October after their initial response? So still another 8 days or so to go....
I purchased an item that was supposedly in stock; it was in stock but in another country and took about two weeks to arrive. Not impressed.
Postage took forever. Just short of two weeks to arrive.

Ordered SSD on 1st March, told it was out of stock and on order.  Rang a couple of weeks later and although now in stock was told delivery would be 11th May!  After protesting told it was being shipped on 22nd March, Royal Mail 24hr but it was in the Czech Republic.  Arrived at the end of March, over four weeks in total.  Could have got item from Amazon next day delivery!

I have not yet received my order and that is why this is a poor review. I ordered from Crucial UK but it turned out the item came from Czech Republic. I ordered on 22 March 2022 and as I write on 30 March 2022 it is still in Europe en route.I asked customer service it it seems this is within the delivery terms (8 business days).To me this is not Crucial UK but Crucial Europe. In future if I buy Crucial products I will buy from UK suppliers

Review.Titre: The RAM was a great boost BUT be warry of the SSD cloning software.
Review.Contenu: The RAM was a great boost. However, the disk clone software to port the system to the SSD failed to produce a bootable drive.  After several tries I just installed a new Windows 10 on the SSD and restored my data from a backup.  I lost all the installed apps and much of my personal system configuration

Review.Titre: Ordering process slick, but terrible shipping.
Review.Contenu: Ordering process slick, but terrible shipping.It took 2 weeks for the memory to arrive. Customer expectations in this day and age are around 24/48 hours.
Double memory and SSD, your own downloadables shows no improvement.Waste of money I guess.

Review.Titre: I should have gone to Amazon
Review.Contenu: I ordered an upgrade to my computer from Crucial on Thursday the 6th October assuming that it would arrive early the following week as I have the week off and can install the upgrade without affecting my work. I did not realise that free delivery meant appalling delivery as it sat for days in the Czech Republic and has not yet arrived in the UK over 1 week later. There was no indication on their site about how long it would take to be delivered and, having found out that it was coming from Prague, there was no option to cancel the order and order from someone else.This is appalling service from a well-respected company which does nothing to enhance their reputation. I wish now that I had bought it from Amazon as it was available with next day delivery. I will never shop with Crucial again.Having seen Crucial’s reply and other comments similar to mine, it seems that the information on shipping times is not clearly stated when people order from the site. Rather than simply repeating what they said to others, they should take steps to ensure that people are really clear about the shipping times for different delivery options.

Review.Titre: Great product and service let down by slow delivery
Review.Contenu: The web service and pc scanner are superb. With every pc components are different and this tool is an asset. However the lack of tracking and really slow delivery is the let down in overall service

Review.Titre: Everythig was fine until UPS turned up…
Review.Contenu: Everythig was fine until UPS turned up at my door asking for imprt duty and handling charge.  After twice being on the phone to UPS for over 40 minutes on hold it turned up out that the UK importers address for paying the VAT was not linked to the shipping order.  As a result it was over two weeks before I got my SSD instead of the 3 day delivery I paid for.

Crucial produce probably the best memory and SSDs but delivery is incredibly poor. I spoke to their customer service to explain that my hard disk was dying and I urgently needed a replacement SSD and was willing to pay for a quick delivery. It took eight days from ordering to delivery.  I could have bought from a local supplier with next day delivery at no extra cost. No doubt they will blame COVID.  Great product but poor delivery times.

Review.Titre: I cancelled the order and they sent it…
Review.Contenu: I cancelled the order and they sent it anyway. They sent a dispatch email around 7 days before they actually shipped it, as shown by the tracking. As a result, it took around 2 weeks to arrive from when the dispatch email was sent. To add to this poor experience, the customer service representative I spoke to to find out why it had been dispatched, despite having cancelled the order, was very abrupt and unhelpful. A real shame as the product was very reasonably priced and works very well.

I was asked by Crucial to write a review so here it is. No problems with the SSD, that gets 5*. However the cost of the unit from Crucial.com, with the wrongly named "express delivery" (3 days to arrive from ROI) was £65.92. What I should have done, and I'm kicking myself here, is looked on Amazon. As a Prime Member I could have got exactly the same unit, delivered the next day, for £55.98 and spent the spare £10 on something useful, a bottle of wine perhaps. Crucial you need to pull your socks up!

Review.Titre: Customer services in India are poor
Review.Contenu: Customer services in India are poor, couldn't help or understood the poor. Eventually I fixed the problem myself and all was in working order. Not really qualified to work

Crucial makes an excellent product, there is no refuting that. Buying off their website takes way too long. It is much quicker to buy from a 3rd party dealer.3 days to create a parcel/package and ship it.6 days to ship. (there is no faster shipping option).

Review.Titre: I would never have bought these RAM…
Review.Contenu: I would never have bought these RAM sticks if i'd known they were going to come all the way from the Czech Republic, and Germany.Waiting all that time for them to be delivered while my new PC parts were'nt able to be installed.

I didn’t receive my parcel.Due to an auto fill error on my phone it pasted the wrong postcode ## Wessington LaneSouth WingfieldDE24 1ABIt should of been## Wessington LaneSouth WingfieldDE55 7NBNow…The funny part is the address to confirm my banking details was also incorrect with the wrong postcode DE24 1AB and should not of processed. That would of made me realise that the address was incorrect due to an autofill error.Now this is more my error then it is yours with the exception of you processing the payment with the incorrect banking address.What I’m really annoyed about is their is no phone number to phone to discuss the error.I sent an email to support but I haven’t received a reply.Royal Mail tracking number no longer exists and I presume it has either been sent back or delivered to an imaginary address.No follow up phone call to confirm if it has been received either.Please get in touch with me to discuss my options… we are talking about £180+ order.07533649015Kind regards,Jonathan
Sent me memory for a laptop which cannot be expanded. Due to my lack of IT skills I asked the software Crucial provides to identify the correct memory. A waste of time and money.

Review.Titre: Great product ..But Uk web site thought…
Review.Contenu: Great product ..But Uk web site thought it was coming from UK but item sent from somewhere in Europe .. 2 week delivery. Time for parts that are required urgently. Deceitful will not use again.

Review.Titre: Still waiting for delivery after two…
Review.Contenu: Still waiting for delivery after two long weeks.
Order got cancelled! I suppose that's better than disappearing with the money, but rather disappointing/

Review.Titre: Nothing on the website explained that…
Review.Contenu: Nothing on the website explained that delivery time was 8 days (it actually turned out to be 12) and nothing said the delivery was not coming from the UK.Support seemed to be based in India and was the same terrible standard I have come to expect from Indian based support centres.I think all companies should make it clear when they are not based in the UK. I would never have purchased if I had known.There was a cheaper option from Amazon US which I did not take because I thought Crucial would have been quicker. The G.Skill product looked much better, was cheaper and would have got here much sooner.The order was for a laptop that I bought from Taiwan. That got here is 3 days so 12 days from the EU is disgraceful.I feel that not disclosing the location and delivery time is simply fraud. They hide behind UK contact details when they are not in the UK. This should be illegal.Update following comment from Crucial.All of my comments still stand. I should not have to read a shipping policy to clearly understand that you are not shipping from the UK. If you are merely an EU company you should make that very clear.Your response shows that you don't care and that you are hiding behind a shipping policy document.If I cannot clearly see the shipping details you are failing as a company and my review was to make it clear to any other customers in the UK that they woulld be better off purchasing elsewhere.
Helpful customer service but very very slow deliver. Will unlikely be ordering direct from Crucial again.

Review.Titre: The replacement SSD was fine BUT!!! - TRULY DIRE SUPPORT.
Review.Contenu: The replacement SSD was fine.  Cloning over the old SSD to the new using Acronis wasn't straightforward, as the options on the software didn't allow the cloning to happen correctlyIn the end I resorted to calling the Crucial helpdesk.  The man I spoke with gave the impression that he really didn't know what to do and we just blundered through a series of options, none of which solved the problem.  In the end he just hung up on  me, which was ABSOLUTELY POOR SERVICE.I managed to resolve the problem myself in the end.  I'm not really sure how, but by keeping trying, it eventually worked.I have however found that some software seems to think that the install is on a new machine and I have had to resolve activation code issues with software vendors.I'm not completely ignorant on PC matters and have done a similar upgrade on a laptop in the past without problems.I will think very carefully before going down this route again in future.My advice is always buy a bigger drive than you think you'll need in the first place.
Unbelievably slow.   Ordered some RAM weeks ago.  Has still not arrived.
Takes forever to ship items to UK

Review.Titre: Not the best order /product return experience
Review.Contenu: I will start off by saying I am a huge fan of crucial products and use crucial RAM and Drives in all my computers, for great quality and performance at a reasonable price point crucial absolutely nail it! I've always bought my crucial components from 3rd party sellers this was the first time I purchased a component directly from crucial and the experience was not great. The first issue I experiences was with the website it looked very insecure (it did not seem very professionally set up, it did was glitchy and did not render well) and took a couple of attempts to put my order through. Immediately after I submitted my order I realised that making a mistake on my order and attempted to cancel it, unfortunately, the 'order cancellation' option did not appear on the page despite me just placing my order (and customer service was not available). Once my item arrived I decide to return it as was my right only to be informed by crucial (via e-mail) that I (the buyer) would have to pay for the return postage (not stated on crucial's website return policy) and I would have to post it to the Czech Republic (I am based in the UK) so that would have been tracked international secured postage. Once I received the 'delivered' notification from the courier I contact crucial customer service to confirm delivery which they confirmed (that was 2.5 weeks ago) and I am still waiting for my refund.
Delivery time is too long.
The delivery is really slow. Beware

Review.Titre: Took so long to be delivered I have…
Review.Contenu: Took so long to be delivered I have returned it
Order was very late. Customer service was pretty awful.
Took 3 weeks to arrive. It's not clear where the stock is held, it's not mentioned on the web site. If memory is in Czechia say so.

Customs fees were not included, or even reported as possible. I often buy in the USA, China or the UE and I have never had customs fees, even for much higher amounts.It seems that it is more common via ups than with other carriers

Delivery was a little slower than I expected. The software downloaded from Crucial for cloning did not recognise the new ssd and I had to use one from another site which worked well.Otherwise i am very pleased with the purchase.

Review.Titre: ram worked well the p5 plus was dead on…
Review.Contenu: ram worked well the p5 plus was dead on arrivalspoken to support still no offer of a refund avoid

Review.Titre: Three days late & happy to review at process end.
Review.Contenu: I did not like the way that, during my two phone calls, the chief aim from the staff spoken-to seemed to be getting good reviews. A request for a review after the entire event is quite okay with me. The item arrived three days late, due Monday and arrived on Thursday. I would have been mollified during the two phone calls, if the full length of the journey was indicated to me at the beginning. I saw part of that distance via a universal tracking app. The item works well.

Good quantity of stock item when I placed my order but next day, informed of NO availability.EIGHT days later, after a few confusing emails and a disappointing chat with customer services; my items arrived.I appreciate the 24hr delivery once stock was in the UK but all other aspects were sub-standard.

Delivery seemed slow by current standards with most online orders.. Shipping was by UPS, tracking via web & app was ok but no option to divert to a collection point if not home on delivery day. Delivery failed as I was out, then order was delivered to a local UPS service point, which was  a store only open 10-6, which meant a few more days passed before I could get the order.

Review.Titre: Good product, took too long to deliver
Review.Contenu: The thing I ordered took nearly two weeks to get to me in the UK. I chose crucial because it looked like they were based in the UK (northern Ireland address) but the memory stick was shipped from Poland and took ages. It is a good product and I decided to buy another but delivery was ridiculous, so I found the same product on Amazon for slightly cheaper and next day delivery.

Review.Titre: Very Slow Delivery of RAM from the Czech Republic
Review.Contenu: The RAM I ordered came from the Czech Republic and took three weeks to arrive! The delay was not caused by postal strikes or Christmas post delays, rather it took some 18 days to clear customs in the Czech Republic, Germany & the Netherlands. A decent product at a decent price but use another supplier if you want your product in a hurry!

Review.Titre: Lenovo Flex Laptop not as SSD-compatible as claimed
Review.Contenu: Purchased the Crucial MX500 1TB SSD to replace my a very slow HDD in Lenovo Flex 2 Pro 15 laptop.  The compatibility checked confirmed the SSD was ok for this laptop.  However, after following instructions and cloning disk to SSD, installing SSD, the laptop reporting disk errors during startup and left it overnight to repair.  This was unsuccessful.  In the end I used Windows Media Creator and changed BIOS settings to use legacy mode to reboot to access SSD.  Partial success!

Delivered in a timely manner, after Covid delays prevented previous order. Not convinced it is right however. Your 'tool' offered me an option of 4GB or 8GB RAM sticks; I ordered 8GB but then noticed the manufacturer recommends like-for-like, so maybe it should have only offered me 4GB. W10 recognises 12GB now but there is no discernible increase in performance.

Review.Titre: the SSD was a good product at a good price
Review.Contenu: the SSD was a good product at a good price.  However I found the purchase information misleading in that it said it was being dispatched by Royal mail 24 hr but it reality it came from Europe so it too about 6 days to arrive.

Ive used crucial before, excellent products (ram & ssd), but i think i had purchased those via amazon.co.ukThis time round, i thought to order directly from uk.crucial.com. I wrongly assumed that the extral ssd I purchased would ship inside the UK, and be delivered within 1week max. Nowhere on the website, when i ordered, did i see it mentioned that in fact the external ssd will shipped from Czech Republic. It took 13 days to arrive! (partly due to uk customs) Had I know this, I would have ordered from amazon or curry's or any other place with local stock.

Review.Titre: problem with accuracy of updater scan
Review.Contenu: I used the updater scan to check for best solution. It suggested using a 16gb (2 x 8gb) kit which would be compatible which i subsequently ordered. When attempting to install I found my laptop had only one ram slot so i could only install one of the memory cards. Very disappointing that their scan tool didn't identify correctly my motherboard capacity. The single ram card has speeded things up though!

Review.Titre: The website is a bit "clunky" and…
Review.Contenu: The website is a bit "clunky" and having ordered twice now I seem to have done this as a guest even though I have my own account so my orders are not showing on my account. My order arrived within 5 days so cannot complain on this as the website states 5-10 days. Disappointed that you can only register SSD products as I have just bought memory which was more expensive.

Review.Titre: Free delivery took 12 days to deliver
Review.Contenu: Free delivery took 12 days to deliver, with very scant tracking information. The same memory is available from Amazon with next day delivery.When fitting the memory in the computer, the computer would not boot. The memory was the correct memory as specified by CrucialReturned the memory for a refund. The refund process was simple, just waiting now to receive the deposit into my account.

Review.Titre: Quality RAM, however delivery is deceptively slow...
Review.Contenu: The RAM is obviously of good Crucial/Micron quality. However, delivery was deliberately misleading: the store implied a UK order with next-day[ish] delivery.In truth, the product gets sent from Czech Republic, and enjoys a bit of interrailing around northern Europe for a week before it even sees our shores.I'll be ordering elsewhere next time, sorry.

Review.Titre: Helpful website but drive didn't last
Review.Contenu: The website is really helpful for identifying the hard drive you need for your machine, and installation wasn't too difficult. However, the solid state drive I bought from them failed completely after 3.5 years. I am disappointed as I've never had a drive fail that quickly before.

Memory was spot on, machine was specced automatically and a set of compatible options created - all good.However delivery was slow, I saw Royal Mail 24 and assumed it would be next day or so, it took 7 days to get from Prague to the UK, Amazon would have delivered much faster.

Review.Titre: I give it only 3 stars because it took…
Review.Contenu: I give it only 3 stars because it took too long to come from Germany Surely UK customers deserve their own local stockI will look At delivery time frames before ordering next time

Review.Titre: Acronis True Image Software Was A Letdown
Review.Contenu: Acronis True Image cloning software didn't recognize that I had installed a Crucial SSD in my laptop, even after I initialized the SSD. The SSD works satisfactorily, but it takes the edge off the experience when you have the additional hassle of downloading and installing other third party software to get it up and running.

It took too long for delivery, it took a week to be shipped and another two weeks for delivery. I do understand the post office workers were on strike for a few days. Overall it was not a good experience especially as I needed the disk for a travel trip.

Postage took ages.RAM seemed incompatible with existing internal despite using the scanner app.And after searching I still don't know how to get support.Finally got it working after leaving the RTC battery disconnected overnight.SSD works grand

The SSD and RAM seem fine, now that they have arrived.  The on line purchased suggested they were coming by Royal Mail Tracked 24hr.  However, this turned out to be after the initial 7 days wending its way around Continental Europe!

Memory plugged in and working no problem, thanks.  But delivery was listed as royal mail 24. But in the small print it says 5-10 business days. It actually took from the 9th to 23rd . I was led to believe it was shipping from Ireland, but shipped from CZ to DE to NE to England to Glasgow to me........ thank goodness it worked. I feel that it needs to be a lot clearer about delivery timescales. Because I'd have bought elsewhere even if more expensive , rather than wait all this time......

product is perfect, its just if they can work on their delivery time in the UK its really bad. I should've got the same SSD from amazon next day with prime it was kinda my fault but still not having a storage in the UK mainland for a company like this. still like your products. Took nearly 2 weeks. stick to amazing if you are buying crucial buy it from amazon instead.

Great RAM thank you, automatically identified and easy to install, works fine. Took over 2 weeks to arrive though thanks to Brexit delays, despite great fast service this end from Royal Mail. Crucial needs to either warn about this or keep stock in the UK.

Review.Titre: The product is fine, but delivery
Review.Contenu: The product is fine, it was the delivery.I was reassured that the seller (digital river) was based in the UK.I did notice on payment that the payment address was in Dublin, Ireland, but that I assumed was for tax purposes.Delivery seemed to consist of a very slow meander across eastern and western Europe.Starting in the Czech Republic, then Poland, Germany, Holland, and eventually to the UK.I've purchased from crucial in the past, and got quick delivery, even on the standard postage.This was not quick, this time.Why are my products coming from the other side of Europe.Apart from delivery, product seems fine.

Delivery took near two weeks which is not good at all. Recommended Crucial Storage Executive application would not recognize this external drive, so it is useless... Drive itself is good and quick, easy recognized by Windows system.

I didn't like not knowing when my order would arrive.  The selected shipping stated 24hr but no mention that the package initially ships from Prague which added a week to that 24hr period.  Ordering was as always fairly easy though your detector didn't recognise my HP Pavilion 15 laptop.

I bought the SSD after running Crucial Advisor on the relevant computer.  But the supplied Acronis cloning software didn't work because of incompatible sector sizes.  After considerable research I found a program that WOULD do the clone.  But, as supplied, the product was useless.
great product, tracking and delivery were shocking, no regular updates. if ordering again, will go via Amazon, as things arrive next day and not 10+ days later.

Review.Titre: Product sent from EU took too long to come to UK
Review.Contenu: The product is fine, but sending the item to the UK from Eastern Europe definitely isn't, as it took a good week to arrive, when it was needed urgently.  If you are in a hurry go elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Order was good but Delivery was slow !
Review.Contenu: Easy to find what compatible part I heeded and ordering ok but delivery was disappointing as it came from abroad and arrived on the 19th but ordered on the 5th so well over 5-8 working days stated. In fairness it was easy to track to see progress but still long delivery period from irder

Review.Titre: You do very well but four days after…
Review.Contenu: You do very well but four days after you informed me the item had been dispatched royal mail are still expecting it and unable to give me a delivery date

Review.Titre: I love the product I bought but.....
Review.Contenu: I love the product I bought, I loved the price, the only thing that disappointed was the delivery time. I've bought memory in the past and it was here next day, the NVMe drive I bought was shipped from Prague and took a long time to arrive which was disappointing as I needed it quicker for a project I was working on. It's here now and I'm very happy with it. My rating is due to delivery time and certainly not the product.

Review.Titre: Great product but shipping was v slow
Review.Contenu: Great product but shipping was v slow - sent from other side of Europe and took 1 & 1/2 weeks to arrive when I could have got from Amazon next day! Packaging for transit also too light and lucky ram wasn't damaged

Review.Titre: Everything seems to be fine with the 8…
Review.Contenu: Everything seems to be fine with the 8 HB memory bought from Crucial.There was a long delay in its arrival due to  Royal Mail strike and the Christmas time volume of mail needing to be delivered.The cost of the memory was pretty high compared to others available in the market. Had I gone to Amazon I could have received an equivalent memory for half the price and lot quicker due to amazon’s own delivery service.The only reason I chose Crucial was I had been a customer with the company in the past. I was very happy in the past. I still trust Crucial but I think it’s pricing needs to be competitive.

Reviewing the Crucial 4TB MX500 SSD and 2 x 8GB DDR3L 1600 memory - purchased to speed up an aging PC. All worked fine and the PC running faster than it ever has. Have no issue with the components and would give 5 stars - I’ve always used Crucial components for system upgrades. The issue is the Acronis software you can download to clone a HDD to the new SSD. Dropped 2 stars for the software. Gave up using Acronis after wasting 3 days and too many hours trying to get it to work, it’s slow, it hangs and gets stuck at different times and could never provide estimated times left with the cloning process. In the end, purchased EaseUS ToDo Backup for £33 and it completed the cloning process in 3hrs for a 3TB HDD to the 4TB SSD with no issues, or hangs, and it provides constant information on the process. I would say, you need to factor in purchasing the disk cloning software if that’s your intention for the new SSD… or purchase from another manufacturer that provides better cloning software for you new SSD.

My order was initially late and eventually deemed lost in transit and had to to be investigated. A second delivery attempt arrived a month later from my initial order. Installation and transfer of my operating system was problematic taking multiple attempts. When eventually everything was completed the drive has proved a worthwhile investment and stopped the computer crashes that was plaguing my computer.

The product itself was fine, it was a little disappointing that the scanner appears to be no longer useful.While the delivery was within the timescale quoted, the updates on the status of the delivery left quite a lot to be desired.

Unfortunately the memory proved not to be 100% compatible and will need returning. The SSD has provided a decent boost to performance albeit limited by the motherboard's SATA 2 architecture.

Review.Titre: Royal mail strikes meant I had to wait…
Review.Contenu: Royal mail strikes meant I had to wait a couple of weeks.  Not your fault as such, but you could consider a number of delivery systems rather than rely upon one.Ordered 21/11; Arrived 7/12

You REALLY need to sort out your delivery times.  I ordered on Jan 27th, you had it in stock, it arrived on 7th Feb.  I know I accepted the 5-10 working days delivery, but with Amazon able to deliver the same product (albeit at a higher price) the next day, why can't you?  And if you can't then you should really start wondering why that is.  Cos everyone expects next-day delivery and you will end up going out of business.  imo.  To be clear, I am not complaining about the product.  I have been using Crucial for 20+ years and your products are A* every single time.  The memory I bought worked a treat.

I am pleased with the deal that I got on the two hard drives that I ordered - thank you.  Unfortunately, the time it took to get them to me left A LOT to be desired and I considered cancelling my order.  UPS have regular access to HMS Raleigh and should know the mail office opening times.  I was given a delivery slot of 0950-1150 and come 1300, I had given up.  I contacted UPS and after some discussion, I was advised that UPS DON'T do delivery slots despite one being sent to me.  They also have a driver who seems to make up his own story regarding the closing time for the Establishment Mail Office which is, and has been for a long time, 1500m on a Friday.  I even offered to meet the driver such was the need for the drives that weekend.  Apparently wasn't achievable. He clearly had no intention of delivering your package on that day.  This resulted in the vital work that I needed to complete over the weekend, with the ordered drives, not being done.  I guess that when someone orders something from Crucial, you trust your Couriers to 'deliver' on your behalf.  This was EXTREMELY poor in this case.     The 3 stars are based upon the great deal that you offered - thank you

My first two experiences of dealing with Crucial and purchasing SSD's was fantastic but it was third time unlucky for me.Using the compatibility checker, I purchased a 2TB SSD drive for my iMac but was not informed that I needed a 2.5" to 3.5" adapter tray as this is listed for PC's. So I paid for what is essentially a piece of bent metal that is designed for PC's NOT iMac so it's a bodge job to fit it.The installation instructions for the iMac are excellent and easy to follow but they refer to keeping the HDD thermal monitor cable available to connect to the SSD when there is no facility on the SSD that is specific to the iMac to refit this.Major downside as the fan in the iMac now runs as if it is trying to cool a blast furnace down because it is not getting data from a sensor. The fix - spend $44 on a third party cable or add some third party software to control the fan.Not good enough Crucial, if you sell drives that are certified 100% compatible by your own compatibility checker, make sure that this is correct otherwise you are misleading customers. Also make sure the HDD adapter is fit for purpose, make one that fits the iMac without having to bodge it in.You have lost any future business, I will seek alternatives for my other iMac's

Review.Titre: Good hardware let down by poor instructions
Review.Contenu: I bought a memory module and an SSD to upgrade my computer. I planned to keep the old hard drive for backup storage. Once I had finished, I ended up with everything I wanted and a PC with better performance than when it was brand new. Based on this, you may ask why I only awarded this 3 stars. The answer is in the instruction for upgrading, or mostly the information that is missing from them. Installing the hardware was fairly straight forward. The SSD only took a few seconds. The memory module did require more force than I would like to use to fully insert it but other than that was simple. The problem came when I started up the upgraded PC It instantly recognised the new memory but there was nothing on the new SSD and there was nothing on windows to indicate it was there. Nothing on the instructions about this other than to say to try re-inserting it which I did but nothing changed. It was only when going into the BIOS on the next restart that I could see it had been recognised but when I got back into windows it still showed nothing. At this point I decided to try the next step of downloading and running the software to copy the hard drive to SSD. This ran and did identify that there was a SSD present. The issue here is that it showed internal names for both the source and destination drive not the windows names. I could have just assumed they were correct and gone ahead but that appeared very dangerous so rebooted and back into the BIOS again where I could see the internal drive names before going back into windows again to run the clone software. This all worked fine so all I had to do was reboot and go back into the BIOS to change the boot drive and restart windows which also all worked fine. One final problem. The original hard disk and new SSD looked identical so I could not tell which one was using the C: and new E: drive letters. The drive properties did not show the internal names. The only way I could tell was by looking at the last updated date/time on windows files and seeing which ones had been updated after switching boot drives. I could have avoided all these issues if the instructions only mentioned that Windows would not initially see the new drive, how the drives would be seen by the cloning software and how windows would allocate drive letters.

Review.Titre: It's like having a new PC
Review.Contenu: I installed a Crucial MX500 1TB SSD in my 10 year old HP Pavilion PC. The increase in speed is amazing. It never started up this quick when it was new. All programs are faster even using the internet is quicker.  Crucial provide lots of guidance to help with the installation, however the recommended Acronis software just wouldn't work. Transferring data from a 2TB HDD to 1TB SSD) After struggling with it for two days I had to purchase some cloning software (EaseUS) which worked fine. I also installed 16GB of Crucial RAM and I'm delighted with the outcome. The SSD arrived quicker than expected. I highly recommend Crucial to others and it would have been 5 stars apart from the cloning issue.

Review.Titre: Everything looked good from the ease of…
Review.Contenu: Everything looked good from the ease of selecting the correct portable SSD drive, the pricing and the ordering process. Everything was confirmed by e-mail with an invoice attached to the e-mail sent after the despatch notice. It all then went rather quiet... Tracking date showed that the parcel had been created 20 July, accepted at the start of its Journey, in Prague, 24 July, reaching Pulheim, 25 July. After a bit of faffing around between Pulheim, The Hague, Southall, then Royal Mail Greenford MC, it reach the Bristol MC, 30 July! Finally delivered without ceremony, 31 July (tracking didn't catch up)! What a journey! Hats off to Royal Mail Tracked 24, who did indeed deliver next working day, once in their hands! Would have been 5 stars if I had been aware of the foregoing!
